Android might finally let users swap their on-screen navigation buttons, a feature Samsung and others have had for years. Linus celebrates the long-overdue fix, rants about Google’s customization lockdown, and gets way too excited about Sony’s Xperia phones, headphone jacks, and waterproof nostalgia.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wlS9ist2qrk

title: Android FINALLY Did It

Microsoft just raised the price of Xbox Game Pass Ultimate by 50%, sparking mass cancellations and frustration among players. Linus and Luke break down what this means for Xbox’s business model, whether Game Pass is still worth it at $30 a month, and how Microsoft’s hardware strategy might be shifting toward third-party partners like ASUS and away from traditional consoles.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wlS9ist2qrk

title: Xbox is Dying

EA has officially been acquired by Saudi Arabia’s Public Investment Fund (PIF), Silverlake, and Affinity Partners in a $55 billion deal. Linus and Luke discuss what this means for the gaming industry, why the valuation raises eyebrows, and whether going private could change how EA operates, or just change who’s pulling the strings.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wlS9ist2qrk

title: They Bought EA, and I'm Concerned
